Upon settling in you will be taken around the home­stay property and given the opportunity to meet and mingle with your host family. After getting to know one another you will have a delicious lunch together. After lunch you can rest for a while. After your afternoon tea, you can visit the Sawantwadi palace; if possible have an interaction with the Queen Mother, and later take a walk in the market. You will also visit the Chitari galli or the Artists lane. In the evening you will enjoy another home cooked dinner and of course a truly relaxing nights’ sleep. DAY 2: Village Ways Early morning, you will go on a Nature Trail in the Amboli Jungles. After the trail, breakfast will be in a traditional home stay nearby. Later back to your place of stay. Freshen up. Today morning you will spend time interacting with the rangoli artists. Rangoli is the art of designing with coloured powder. The artist will take thru the journey on how the simple designing has undergone change over the period of time. Lunch will be at the home stay. Post lunch you will be taken around the village. You will get to experience the various mechanisms that make a village function. You will meet the village headman and interact with him/her. You will also get the opportunity to interact with village self help groups. These groups are essentially for women to make them economically self sufficient. You will be visiting a self help group unit. Tea and refreshments will be served by the local village women. Later you will view a garland making demonstration. Evening you will head back to the home stay. DAY 3: Puppetry After breakfast, you will visit the Fruit Research station. Here you will get to see the varieties of fruits. On your way back to the home stay, you will visit the Cashew factory. Here you will see the cashew processing. You can also shop for cashews. Lunch at the home stay. After tea you can visit the Pinguli tribal Puppetry village. Enjoy the art gallery in the village. Dinner will be traditional cooked on fire wood and earthen ware at the home stay. DAY 4: Departure from Sawantwadi Today you can sleep in and wake up to have a relaxed breakfast with your host family. After you finish your meal it will be time to pack up your belongings, say your goodbyes to your gracious host family and depart for your onward journey home, surely with many wonderful memories from your trip.
strTitle: Stay with Villagers, Hike Nature Trails and Enjoy Puppetry

strIntroduction: The smells, the sounds and the sights. Awaken your senses completely. If you are a nature lover, this package is for you. Spend your days exploring the flora and fauna of the jungles. Sindhudurg region is one of the 11 natural bio diversity reserves in the world. You will find variety of species of flora and fauna. Indeed a treat for the nature lover! Detailed Tour Itinerary DAY 1: Arrival in Sawantwadi Upon arrival at your home­stay in Sawantwadi, you will be warmly welcomed by your Indian host family with a traditional garland and tikka. Your hosts will then assist you with the registration procedure and show you to your room. Upon settling in you will be taken around the home­stay property and given the opportunity to meet and mingle with your host family. After getting to know one another you will have a delicious lunch together. After lunch you can choose to depart for an optional ‘experience’ of your choice or spend the day relaxing at your home­stay and enjoying the beautiful surroundings. In the evening you will enjoy another home cooked dinner and of course a truly relaxing nights’ sleep. DAY 2: Nature Trail Wake up early morning. Wear your sturdy walking shoes for an exciting trail into the Amboli Jungles. The Amboli jungles nestles some rare species of amphibians and reptiles. There are also some 108 odd varieties of butterflies. Your guide will take you into an exciting journey. The trail is 3 hrs long. After the trail, you will be treated to a delicious, hot breakfast. Back to the home stay. The afternoon is free for you to relax and soak in the peaceful atmosphere. In the evening you can sit down for another home cooked Indian dinner before heading off to bed. DAY 3: Snorkeling Today you can sleep in and have a relaxed breakfast as the morning is free at leisure for you to enjoy. You may want to join a cultural workshop or choose an optional ‘experience’ to keep yourself occupied. After lunch, you will be heading out for today’s exciting activity...Snorkeling! Enjoy the afternoon with a professional team assisting you as you discover the underwater world of this spectacular region. In the evening, head back to your home­stay for a delicious dinner prepared by your host family and another peaceful nights’ sleep. DAY 4: Bear Trail Enjoy a tasty breakfast at your home­stay before heading out to the Dajipur Jungles for bear sighting. Enjoy the gorgeous flora and fauna of the region while driving through the jungle. With some luck and professional guidance you might just see a real bear! After the trail you will have lunch before enjoying the rest of the day at leisure. Perhaps you want to venture into town and go for an optional shopping trip to find treasures for yourself and loved ones at the local market. In the evening you will return to your home­stay for a specially prepared dinner and a good nights' sleep. DAY 5: Departure from Sawantwadi Today you can sleep in and wake up to have a relaxed breakfast with your host family. After you finish your meal it will be time to pack up your belongings, say your goodbyes to your gracious host family and depart for your onward journey home, surely with many wonderful memories from your trip.
strTitle: Explore the Indian Jungle and Stay with a Rural Family

strIntroduction: Marathas were a formidable force in the country in the 16­17 century. The Maratha empire had spread its wings from the Sahayadri range in the western Ghats to Attack, the north west frontier of the country. Spearheaded by the visionary King Shivaji, the Great, the Sindhudurg forts stands a testimonial. Detailed Tour Itinerary DAY 1: Arrival in Sawantwadi Upon arrival at your home­stay in Sawantwadi, you will be warmly welcomed by your Indian host family with a traditional garland and tikka. Your hosts will then assist you with the registration procedure and show you to your room. Upon settling in you will be taken around the home­stay property and given the opportunity to meet and mingle with your host family. After getting to know one another you will have a delicious lunch together. After lunch you can rest for a while. After your afternoon tea, you can visit the palace. Sawantwadi Palace is the seat of the royal family of Bhosale. The family traces its antecedents to Shivaji, the Great Maratha warrior. You will be meeting the Queen, Smt Satvashila raje Bhosale. You can go around the palace grounds, visit the in-­house museum and darbar hall. Later , you can take a walk in the market and head back to your homestay. DAY 2: Sindhudurg Fort Wake up and enjoy the warmth of a home made Indian breakfast prepared caringly by your host family. Today you will visit the Sindhudurg fort, the only fort to have been built in the middle of the sea. It’s a wonder. You will be taken down the history lane. Sindhudurg Fort stands as a testimonial to Shivaji, The great Maratha warrior’s vision and foresightedness. You will head back to the homestay for a late lunch. Evening at leisure. DAY 3: Vijaydurgh Fort and Girye Today you will have the opportunity to visit yet another Fort. Vijaydurgh was captured by Shivaji, the great Maratha warrior from the Siddhis. This fort is 850 years old. Its a beautiful fort by the sea and is a proud testimonial of valour. Lunch will be in a mango orchard on the way back to the homestay. You can have relaxed evening at your homestay. DAY 4: Departure from Sawantwadi Today you can sleep in and wake up to have a relaxed breakfast with your host family. After you finish your meal it will be time to pack up your belongings, say your goodbyes to your gracious host family and depart for your onward journey home, surely with many wonderful memories from your trip.
strTitle: Tryst With Royalty: Palaces and Forts of Sawantwadi

strIntroduction: Discover the holy river and the magic of Old Delhi, with a visit to the mystic riverbank and a view of the ghats from the river. Behind every historical capital there is a great big river. The route is an ode to this river that has been a silent witness to Delhi’s history and is now a recurrent victim of its excesses. Starting from the little lanes of Shahjahanabad, while the city is still sleepy in its proverbial sockspassing along the magnificently formidable walls of the Red Fort we find ourselves on the meditative quiet banks of the Yamuna at Nigambodh Ghat. A boat-tride along its shores – migratory birds circling above the calm waters - unravels the ritualistic devotion with which the Hindus treat the historic river. Despite its current struggles with pollution, the Yamuna is a goddess to the eyes of her devotees. Concluding with a memorable view of the Jama Masjid back through the streets of Old Delhi, the Yamuna Route is a true experience in the stimulating contradictions that is India. During the summer season (Feb.-August), the Yamuna tour does not include the boat ride due to the water condition. The Yamuna tour will still include a fascinating stop at the riverbank and a visit to the nearby cow shelter.
strTitle: Bike along Delhi's Holy River: the Yamuna

strIntroduction: In this activity, we'll explore Meghalaya. Meghalaya is a land of indigenous tribes with diverse cultures, beliefs and costumes, consisting of the Khasi, the Jaintia, and the Garo Hills. The Khasi and Jaintia Hills form the central and eastern part of Meghalaya and are higher in elevation than the Garo Hills. These hills are full of limestone deposits. These slopes also get more rainfall annually than anywhere else in the world. All these factors come together to make for ideal conditions for cave formation. In this exploratory trip, we'll learn the basics of caving – or spelunking – and begin to explore the state's limestone caves. We'll also hike the historic David Scott trail, snorkel and dive in one of the clearest rivers in the world, as well as visit the double decker root bridge, the only one of it's kind in the world. Come join us as we explore this diverse and magical land. We will be joined by a team of expert cavers from the region who have spent their lives exploring the area. A team of guides, with mountaineering and first aid certifications, will also accompany you. ITINERARY : 11th March 2013: Shillong to Cherrapunjee – Hike the David Scott Trail Overnight in dormitory in Sa-I-Mika, Cherrapunjee Meals: None 12th March 2013: Caving to Krem Mawmluh Overnight in dormitory in Sa-I-Mika, Cherrapunjee Meals: None 13th March 2013: Trek to Living Root Bridges Overnight in dormitory in Sa-I-Mika, Cherrapunjee Meals: None 14th March 2013: Introduction to Vertical Caving- Krem Ri-Blai Overnight in dormitory in Sa-I-Mika, Cherrapunjee Meals: None 15th March 2013: Cherrapunjee – Mawlynnong Village - Shnongpdeng Village campsite Meals: Breakfast, lunch, and dinner 16th March 2013: Rapelling & Ziplining in Shnongpdeng Meals: Breakfast, Lunch 17th March 2013: Depart Before you say goodbye to the Geckos today, don’t forget to buy some orange flower honey. You can also buy cinnamon and other spices that are cultivated in and near Cherrapunji. You should definitely buy Meghalaya tea which has a distinctly lighter flavor compared with Assam or Darjeeling tea.
strTitle: 3/11-17 Exploratory Caving Trip in Meghalaya

strIntroduction: Enjoy the lush green hills of Meghalaya by camping out in mesmerizing Mawphlang. Visit traditional Khasi villages, interact with the locals and try unique ethnic dishes. Mawphlang is a perfect weekend getaway for a relaxing outdoor & cultural experience. Itinerary: Day 1: Leave Guwahati early morning for Lynkien village via Shillong. Set up camp at Maplepine farm by the river. Explore nearby areas and visit the local Khasi village. Interact with locals. Campfire in the evening. (optional - try ethnic Khasi dishes) Dinner at 9 PM Day 2: After breakfast, go out for a short hike to the Mawphlang sacred forest. Picnic lunch at the forest. get back to camp by afternoon. Leisure time. Campfire in the evening. Dinner at 9 PM Day 3: After breakfast drive out to Shillong and then to Lake Umiam. Halt for a while at the lake and drive back to Guwahati to reach by afternoon. Trip ends.
strTitle: Camp and Hike the Lush Green Hills of Megalaya

strIntroduction: We've all had those moments of looking out at a distant snow-capped mountain from our airplane window or seeing a poster of unreal white slopes or watching videos of people racing down mountains on their snowboard. Here's your chance to bring that distant image closer. Along with Memcorp, we're taking you on a dream journey to Gulmarg! With training from certified professionals, we'll make our way down the majestic slopes, swishing and swirling in the snow! Explore the beautiful Kashmiri sights while snowboarding through the day and discover star patterns in the night-sky, bundled up by a bonfire! Make friends, share stories and take back memories for a lifetime! Come strike snowboarding off your bucket list! Get Snow Stoked!
strTitle: Snowboard in the Himalayas & Enjoy Kashmir's Gorgeous Sights

strIntroduction: You might know what goes into your favourite coffee bottle. But to know just what is behind it, go a little beyond the label. And come with us to Chikmagalur. Trust us, you'll never look at your morning brew the same again. Saying "coffee" seems incomplete without saying "estate" right after. So let's start there. Bound by the Bhadra River on one side and rolling hills on the other three, this nearly 100-year-old estate sprawls over 350 lush acres. It's still run by the family that founded it and, needless to say, their love of the land shows all over the estate. Take, for instance, the care and love with which the original planter's bungalow has been maintained. That's where you'll be staying, by the way. Set amidst of fruit trees, this 50 year old marvel boasts exquisite planters' furniture casually strewn around its drawing room, dining room and four bedrooms. It comes with the whole complement of efficient staff, the crown jewel of which is the most aptly named Amma, the resident cook who puts out spreads as if guests were her own children. We've also organised cookinges in which Amma will gladly show you how she weaves her magic. But if you think this breakaway is about sitting back and lazily sleeping off Amma's gastronomic indulgences, think again. With its towering old trees shrouded in broad leaves and creepers and the roads little more than dirt tracks, the property is more Entwood than estate. And it throws up an almost Tolekinesque range of experiences for the intrepid. There's a drive up to the highest peak, from where we can enjoy a peg or a mug and admire the setting sun as it winks goodbye over the Bhadra River. There's an easy trek through the woods, picking herbs and leaves, including those favoured by bison (while they aren't looking, of course) and bringing them back to the house for Amma to transform into delicious chutneys. There's also a short walk to a secret waterhole, where you can try your luck at some joy fishing and on a short stroll to the nearby bridge, where watching thousands of fruit bats (not of the Dracula variety) take off against the evening sky is a sight you're not likely to forget any time soon. And then, our piece de resistance - a night walk around the estate, where we might run into some deer, wild boar and if we're really lucky, bison. You can't come to a coffee estate without meeting the star of the show, can you? And since its picking season, the star is out on show. We'll take you picking and teach you not just which beans to pick, but also how to roast them. And that's not all. Did you know that coffee estates play the perfect hosts for pepper farming? No? Then you also wouldn't know that pepper is another thing you're going to learn to pick. We'd also love to promise you areca nut picking, but clambering up a dangerously thin looking palm and jumping from one to the other might not be your cup of coffee. Don't worry though - the beans you've picked most certainly will be. So come, breakaway and discover just why there's more to your coffee than the beans or their blend.
strTitle: What's Behind your Brew? A Coffee Plantation Trail in India

strIntroduction: Live one day of your life as something other than just a biker. Live one day of your life as one of our villagers. Travel and ride 220kms from Mumbai with us and come breathe – fresh air, eat – simple yet delicious local cusines, partake – in village activites working alongside farmers in a field and ride around our village to learn about local myths and interesting stories.
strTitle: Escape from Mumbai by Motorbike

strIntroduction: This is one of the first villages adopted by Grassroutes, where the local self-development initiative was encouraged. Like most villages across India, this one too has its legends, its very own people and several unique offerings for those who come from the other urban world. At 1000 m above sea level in the western ghats, between river Kurkundi and river Mula, the local folklore connects the village to the legend of goddess zakobhai, to whom one of Purushwadi’s temples is dedicated. It is believed that the goddess lifted up five Hanuman statues from different villages in the region and threw them in the nearby Mula river, a feat she repeats every year when the statues are put upright. The local communities are predominantly tribal and concentrate on cultivation and animal husbandry for their livelihoods. Among the different tribes of the region are bails, kolis mahadeos, thakars, koli dhors, takare kolis, paradhis, kokanas, warlis, kathodis and katkaris. Here's a sample of the experiences you'll enjoy: - Stay with a local in Rural India. - Eat Organic Vegetarian food prepared by the Local Women. - Trekking - Nature Walks - Temple Tour - Riverside Fun & Games - Pluck your fruits - Rice Pounding/Collecting Water/Pluck and eat! - Learn how to grow your own food - Chopping wood for the Bonfire [If it’s not raining!]] - Preparing food with the Women - Corn Barbecue / Toasting Marshmallows around the bonfire
strTitle: Experience Village Life in Purushwadi

strIntroduction: Spend a day in love with water in the city! Lakes spread all over Delhi, a saga of water in the city. Some brimming with abundance, and some dried up in today’s waterless climate. Some natural lakes, and some man made ones. Visit holy lakes, historical lakes, Brimming with stories if not water, And spend a day learning to love water... Places we'll visit: - Surajkund Lake, just outside Delhi, 10th century - Haus Khas Reservoir, 13th century - Sarovar at Bangla Sahib, 17th century - Naini Lake, Model Town, 20th century Photos by: Jyoti Prakash Bhattacharjee, Varun Shiv Kapur, Karan Thapa, Mayank Austen Soofi, Carole Harris, Kabilan Sathyamurthy, Ken Wieland, Vasudha Wadhera
strTitle: Lakes of Delhi: Spend a Day Learning to Love Water

strIntroduction: Hone your green thumb, become a gardener, enjoys history & greenery. We take you to the popular nurseries of Delhi, both government and private owned. The nurseries of Delhi are not just places where you can buy plants, seeds and gardening equipment, but experiences that come alive with the history and culture that surrounds them. Places we'll visit: - Sunder Nursery, Nizamuddin: India’s largest nursery spread over 70 acres, dotted with historical monuments - Mehrauli Flower Market: a popular flower market selling fresh flowers every morning - Chiragh Nursery, Chiragh Dilli - Rajdhani Nursery, Jorbagh Photos by: Karan Thapa and Mayank Austen Soofi
strTitle: Explore the Plant Nurseries of Delhi

strIntroduction: Where have all the flowers gone? Posthumously yours, the flower markets of Delhi: The 3 main flower markets at Fatehpuri, Connaught Place and Mehrauli, an integral part of the city’s heritage and culture, and temples of beauty amidst the concrete jungle are now history, thanks to the Delhi government’s myopia. Come witness a disaster of urban planning and the lack of common sense in this city, as we visit the sites of the markets and experience the sad and eerie silence where once a million flowers bloomed. We will trace how the flower trade has reconfigured itself around these sites, and also visit Ghazipur, a landfill outside the city where part of the flower trade has been officially relocated. Itinerary & places we'll visit: - Homage to Mehrauli market, walking through the site - Exploring new informal markets around Mehrauli and Chattarpur - A visit to Ghazipur, the official new flower market Photos by: Saurabh Mehta, Monica Kapur, Meher & Karan, Saptorishi Majumndar, Shilpa Sharma, Harshvardhana Durugadda
strTitle: (The disappeared) Flower Markets of Delhi

strIntroduction: Rajasthan is well-known for its palaces and forts and one of the most famous destinations for tourists. However, Rajasthan has another face: its people! In this experience, not only will you get to stay like a royal at castle, but you'll also get to meet local Rajasthani people. You'll also get to explore villages and experience firsthand the various mechanisms that make the village tick. You can be a part of the morning opium meet, go spend the day with Rabaaddi Tribes, learn the art of Block Printing, and watch the sun go down behind the awe inspiring rock formations in the evenings. Detailed Itinerary DAY 1: You alight at the NANA station if travelling by train or at the Jodhpur/Udaipur airport. You will be met by our representative. Our representative will escort you to your place of stay. Welcome and registration, you can have refreshments and retire to your room for freshening and a rest. Later you can meet your hosts, get to know them. Lunch will be with the family. A siesta. After afternoon tea, you will be taken on a Tour of the Rawala, (a small haveli), your place of stay for the next 3 days. Later, you will visit the Rabbaddi Dhani, home of the shepherds. Participate in the blanket weaving activity from goat hair. Dinner will be with the Thakur Saab and his wife Ladissa. DAY 2: Early morning rise, after breakfast depart for Ranakpur, The Exquisite Carved Jain Temples. Today you will have a village lunch in a place called Bhanpura. Bhanpura is known for its Persian wheels still in use for irrigating the fields. After a lunch of Makke Ki Roti, Batuaye Ki Kadhi and Saag, you take your afternoon nap on the Charpayi under the mango tree. Have tea and leave for Kumbhalgarh Fort, a magnificent fort nestling in the Aravalis, the oldest mountain range in the world and probably the most beautiful. Visit the fort and see the sound and light show. Return back to your stay in time for dinner. DAY 3: After a relaxed breakfast, you can cycle to the Jawai Lake for crocodile sighting. Picnic at the lake. Come back to the Rawala for a siesta. Today, there will be a royal feast laid out for you. You can be a part of the preparations. Royal dinner with a cultural program. DAY 4: After breakfast, bid goodbye to your host family and proceed to your onward journey.
strTitle: Live like a King: Stay at a Palace & Visit Forts & Temples

strIntroduction: Rajasthan is a most popular tourist destination known for its palaces and forts. There is another face to Rajasthan: its people! With Culture Aangan, you can take the opportunity to connect with the people who contribute to the thickly woven, intrinsic social carpet. You will explore the villages of Rajasthan and experience firsthand the various mechanisms that tick the village life. You can be a part of the morning opium meet, go spend the day with Rabaaddi Tribes, learn the art of Block Printing, and evenings watch the sun go down behind the awe inspiring rock formations. Detailed Tour Itinerary DAY 1: You alight at the JAWAI Baandh station if travelling by train or at the Jodhpur/ Udaipur airport. You will be met by our representative. Our representative will escort you to your place of stay. Welcome and registration, you can have refreshments and retire to your room for freshening and a rest. Later you can meet your hosts, get to know them. Lunch will be the family. Galthani, a village in the Pali district, embodies even today, in the 21st century, all the elements that made a village in ancient times a self reliant unit. The village itself has grown in proportions and population today, but still retains the old architecture homes, the narrow lanes. You will be a part of the village community for the next 3 days. After tea, you will depart for leopard sighting. Late evening back to the village for dinner. DAY 2: Today the day is spent in the village.You will be taken on a conducted tour of the village. You will get to understand the story behind the functioning of the village. You will meet the important persons of the village, the movers and shakers – the potters, embroidery workers, the carpenters, school teachers and many more. Interact with them; learn the various traditional ways of cooking class. Evening, participate in a folk lore performance. DAY 3: Early morning rise, after breakfast depart for Ranakpur, the exquisite carved Jain Temples. Today you will have a village lunch in a place called Bhanpura. Bhanpura is known for its Persian wheels still in use for irrigating the fields. After a lunch of Makke Ki Roti, Batuaye Ki Kadhi And Saag, you take your afternoon nap on the charpayi under the mango tree. Have tea and leave for Kumbhalgarh Fort, a magnificent fort nestling in the Aravalis, the oldest mountain range in the world and probably the most beautiful. Visit the fort and see the Sound And Light Show. You return back to your stay in time for dinner. DAY 4: After breakfast, bid goodbye to your hosts and proceed for your onward journey
strTitle: Village Homestay in Rajasthan & visit its Forts and Temples

strIntroduction: Have you ever harbored a wish to own a piece of land and grow your own vegetables or food grains? This experience will give you the chance to be a farmer for a day! You will visit the local farmer in his field and learn the nuances of farming. You will also get the chance to sow the seeds, plough the field as per the need of the season, and have lunch with the farmer's family.
strTitle: Learn to Grow Vegetables & Have Lunch with a Farmer

strIntroduction: If every monument you’ve ever seen has been through the lens of a camera, if you’ve captured every emotion of the people you love, if the only way you see art is through a photograph, then you’re a Photodiarist and you need to be on this trip! Through our trip to Hampi, we will explore not only this erstwhile capital of the magnificent Vijayanagar Empire, but also the artist within you! With the help of travel photographer and vagabond Prachi Chaphekar, we hope to assist you in finding your own creative expression using a camera as your weapon of choice! Hampi is a land of diverse experiences. Join us in exploring these experiences through bouldering and climbing to the top of mammoth rocks, cycling through the quaint bylanes, jumping into cool, calm lakes, making music by a bonfire and getting lost in the galaxies of stars looking down at us! If this is something that seems interesting to you, give us a shout and block a spot! Disclaimer : This is not a professional photography course. We will not conduct ‘know-your-camera’ sessions. You do not need a fancy camera or much experience. All you need is the urge to create!
strTitle: Hampi: Bouldering, Cycling, Bonfires, Star Gazing and more

strIntroduction: Spend 3 days in The Blue Matsya (The Blue Fish) - a quaint little beach house in a sleepy town near Manipal on the Konkan coast of India. Mornings will be spent observing the waves and theory lessons on surfing and safety. Come evening and that’s when all the real action starts, learn surfing from a few friends at The Shaka Surf Club, they guarantee that in no time you will be standing upright on the surfing board and catching that perfect wave. Believe us when we say so, we have tried, few things match the trill. Late evenings will be spent telling travel tales and marinating your own barbeque around a bonfire.
strTitle: Learn to Ride the Perfect Wave on the Konkan Coast of India

strIntroduction: Tungnath is the Highest Shiva temple in the world, but heavy winter snows leave it out of reach to most pilgrims. This is when we'll make our pilgrimage, when you don't need to share this place with anybody else. But be warned, it's not easy. We'll have long trekking days in deep snow (but, we can bring snow shoes!) This is in the shadow of the might og Garhwal Himalays, with Mt. Chaukhamba almost always visible. Above the temple is the Chandrashila (moon rock) peak at 4000 meters, and we'll also try to climb to the top of this mountain. A recommended add on is an extra night at the Deorital lake, which is completely surrounded by snow in winters. Accompanying me on the trip will be a local guide, a cook and porters. We'll sleep in tents, and I can also provide warm sleeping bags. This trip will take 7 days.
strTitle: Winter in Tungnath: Trek to the World's Highest Shiva Temple

strIntroduction: This is a walk around the bustling heart of Mumbai for an inside look into the work of those who this dependable city depends on. How? By experiencing a day in the hectic life of the washermen of Dhobi Ghaat and the dabbawalas. Our walk is led by Ramanand with whom there is never a dull moment. He makes sure you look at things you wouldn't normally pay attention to, and he knows of all the best eating places few others know. Dhobi Ghaat at Cuffe Parade is unlike any laundry service you have ever seen. Washermen are hard at work beating the dirt out of clothes at stone cubicles, while others hang a kaleidoscope of clothes out to dry on makeshift lines quite ingeniously, without the help of clothes pins. Whether it is two thousand white sheets a day for the Four Seasons Hotel, or the saris of women from high-rises across the city, these dhobis get the job done cheerily and efficiently. You haven't experienced Mumbai if you haven't used its lifeline - its public transport. On this experience, you will enjoy unusual views in double-decker BEST buses and the all-too famous local trains. Feel the sea breeze on your face as you whizz past Marine Drive on your way to Churchgate to meet with the dabbawallas. A word of caution: these guys don't have the time for interviews and photographs. You will just about manage to scramble into their compartment on the train, where the floor is covered by tiffins and lunch packs of every possible shape and size. It's fascinating to see those dabbas carted from one end of the city to the other, and to everywhere in between. The footpath outside Churchgate station serves as a reconnaissance point, where the men in Gandhi topis wade among rows of hundreds of dabbas, and take them to offices where hungry executives wait in earnest for their home cooked meal to arrive each day. Discover a league of Mumbaikars who are as intrinsic to the city as its own soul.
strTitle: Meet the Washermen and Dabbawalas of Mumbai

strIntroduction: The trek to Chopta and Chandrashila offers amazing views of the imposing Himalayan range including Trishul, Nanda Devi and Chaukhamba, and is one of the most popular treks among trekking enthusiasts. Chopta is popularly known as the 'Mini Switzerland' in Uttarakhand and Northern India and is situated amidst thick forests of pine, deodar and rhododendrons. The trek route takes one to Tungnath (literal meaning: ‘Lord of the Peaks’) – the highest Hindu temple in the world dedicated to Lord Shiva. Beyond Tungnath is the summit to the Chandrashila peak (it literally means ‘Moon Rock’) – an impressive vantage point that offers 360 degrees panoramic views of the mighty Himalayas. This is a beautiful trek, with difficulty level rated as easy to moderate. DAY 1: Rishikesh – Sari We meet at Rishikesh early in the morning and drive to Sari Village on the Ukhimath-Chopta road in Uttarakhand. We set up camp by evening for an overnight stay and prepare for the next day’s trek. DAY 2: Sari – Deoria Tal (7,900 ft) – Sari After breakfast, we start our trek to Deoria Tal – a heavily wooded emerald lake with lush green surroundings and snow covered mountains in the backdrop. The mighty peaks of Chaukhamba and Neelkanth are reflected in the pristine waters of this lake – it’s a photographer’s delight. The 3km trek is largely uphill through dense forests. The legend is that the Devas bathed in this lake, hence the name. The lake is sometimes believed to be the “Indra Sarovar” referred to in the Puranas. It is also believed that it was the place where Yaksha asked the Pandavas to answer his questions before drinking the water of the lake. After spending some time here, we’ll trek down to Sari for an overnight stay in tents. DAY 3: Sari – Chopta (9,500 ft) In the morning we make our way to Chopta – a small but picturesque hamlet with untouched natural beauty and peace. It is the starting point of the trek to Tungnath. A 12km trek from Sari will get us to Chopta. Once there, we’ll set up camp and explore the surrounding areas in the evening. The campsite at Chopta affords spectacular views of the high snow-clad mountains. DAY 4: Chopta – Tungnath (12,070 ft) – Chandrashila (13,415 ft) – Chopta After an early morning breakfast, and with packed lunches, we start our trek to Tungnath. The 3km long trail takes one through lush green meadows and finally joins a pilgrim trail which goes all the way up to the Tungnath temple – one of the five and the highest Panch Kedar temples located in the mountain range of Tunganath in Rudraprayag district. After a little relaxation and a lunch break here, we’ll push for the Chandrashila summit. It is a short (1km) but rigorous hike to the top. The view from the top is most promising and truly breathtaking – something one will surely remember for a lifetime. Later, we’ll retrace our steps to the campsite in Chopta for an overnight stay in tents. DAY 5: Chopta – Rishikesh In the morning, after breakfast, we wind up camp and drive back to Rishikesh via Rudraprayag and Devprayag.
strTitle: Trekking in the Himalayas: Chopta and Chandrashila

strIntroduction: Lush green valleys enveloped by snow-capped mountains; retreating glaciers interspersed with flowing streams and cascading waterfalls; an ancient Gurudwara - the highest in the world - adorned by a sacred ‘snow lake’; and of course a carpet of dainty flowers blooming in vibrant colours; such is the splendor of nature and wonder of monsoon that greets you as you trek into the interior of the Garhwal Himalayas. The Valley of Flowers National Park is a UNESCO World Heritage Site, which bursts into a kaleidoscope of colour as the monsoon breathes life into over 300 different species of flowers. At an altitude of 10200 ft to 11200 ft, the months of July and August are ideal to visit the Valley. Hemkunt Sahib - A pilgrimage site surrounded by seven mountain peaks; the star-shaped structure of Hemkunt Sahib Gurudwara, situated on the shores of Hemkunt Lake is of great significance to the Sikh community. Guru Gobind Singh Ji, the 10th Sikh Guru, is said to have meditated here. The activity will include: - Day 1: Travel via a car bus from Delhi to our first base camp in Govindghat, stay overnight here - Day 2: Trek to our second base camp (14 kms) to Ghangaria, stay overnight here - Day 3) Trek to Valley of Flowers (5 kms one way) and spend the entire day in a land of fairies, in the evening we will trek back to Ghangaria and spend the night here - Day 4: Trek to Hemkunt Sahib - the world's highest pilgrimage point (5 kms one way), take a dip in the holy (and icy) waters here, trek back to Ghangaria in the evening - Day 5 - Travel back to Delhi
strTitle: Trek to the Valley of Flowers & Hemkunt Sahib

strIntroduction: Your Golden Triangle Tour will be unique as we will make sure you enjoy every bit of your trip and experience a true and royal time. The tour will be full of adventure, fun and excitement which will make you astonished by the time you come to the end of the trip. We will start from Delhi, the capital city Delhi is the Indian capital, full of Mughal and Imperial architectural beauty throughout. The largest mosque in south-east Asia Jama Masjid and Red Fort are the two most visited places in Old Delhi. Also get a chance to see the tallest minarets Qutub Minar. Next destination is Agra The city of Taj is connected via Yamuna Express Highway which will take you straight to Tajmahal in 2 hours. Apart from the marble beauty standing in the memory of beautiful Mumtaj, you can also see the Red Fort of Agra which is better known as Agra Fort. End the journey with Royal Jaipur Feel the royal past. Make your trip memorable and exciting by spending time in the Palaces where once royal kings used to stay. Enjoy the trip to Hawamahal and let yourself fall in love with the hospitality of the city. This Delhi-Agra-Jaipur trip will give you an open horizon to explore and will offer you more than you have ever imagined. So be ready to see the real India along with the majestic Tajmahal!
strTitle: Explore India's Outdoors and Heritage in the Golden Triangle

strIntroduction: Do you feel vigorous, strong, and confident and love the excitement brought by adrenaline flowing through your veins? Do you love to struggle with waves, mountain streams or cascades? Then we'd like to dare you for some challenging experiences of Rishikesh rafting, Himalaya trekking and Ganga beach camping at Rishikesh. Our vast knowledge of the region, experienced guides and eco-friendly staff with ability to shoot small problems has helped us in providing quality services, combined with Indian Hospitality at a reasonable price. Here tourism is a kind of pilgrimage. We will cover two courses: one from our camp towards Rishikesh and the second one from Devprayag till our campsite. Here's what the experience includes: Transportation to/from Delhi All meals Rafting experts and Guides Accommodation at a camp site right on the Ganges or a 3 star hotel (my recommendation is the former; it means roughing it out, but it's awesome!)
strTitle: Go White Water River Rafting in Rishikesh

strIntroduction: Jutting proudly out of Phang Nga Bay, Khao Phing Kan is an iconic sight, fondly remembered as the hideout of James Bond’s nemesis, Scaramanga, in The Man with the Golden Gun. Our superb full-day Phang Nga Bay tour takes you up close to the towering limestone peak for excellent views, as well as many other amazing destinations in this protected area. ************************************************************************************************ WHAT YOUR DAY WILL LOOK LIKE Sights Covered (Depending on the tide and how crowded it is, our sights or itinerary may slightly alter - This is to ensure the best tour possible for our guests) Phang Nga Bay James Bond Island Panak Island Hong Island Panyee Village Naka Island You’ll never forget this exciting James Bond Island tour, and it’s sure to be one of your best mementos of Thailand. Board our comfortable and stylish speedboat and let us whisk you off into the lush beauty of Phang Nga Bay… We’ll make a stop at the legendary James bond Island, giving you plenty of time to get the perfect photograph, and learn the story of this iconic Thai landmark. You’ll then enter the famous caves, hongs and lagoons of Phang Nga Bay Panak and Hong Island. A lot of our guests recommend this as the absolute highlight of the tour - it is truly mind-blowing! We'll be leaving the speedboat for a while and slip into kayaks, to paddle easily through the enigmatic mangrove forest, another very popular experience with our guests. You almost feel as though you’re in another world, such is the silence and beauty all around. Next stop is Panyee Village for a delicious and authentic Thai buffet lunch, followed by a tour of this well-known fishing community. Resting on stilts, the colourful houses look as though they are floating in the bay, and it’s fascinating to wander around and watch scenes of daily village life going on all around. Before returning to Phuket, there will be time for a refreshing swim at Naka Island. You'll be reflecting on the amazing scenery you've experienced throughout the day! On arrival back at the marina, a minibus will be waiting to transfer you back to your accommodation. The memories of your day in Phang Nga Bay will stay with you for a long time. ************************************************************************************************ MODERN & UNCROWDED SPEEDBOAT Safety is our number on priority, which is why we only use top quality equipment and run our tours on modern, regularly serviced, speed boats. We never allow more than 25 passengers on the boat, so all our guests can enjoy their own space and travel in comfort. ************************************************************************************************ CRUISE OPTION The similar itinerary as above, except Panyee Village & Naka Island, hop aboard a big cruiser & lunch on boat. This is for people who do not mind the the extra people on board in return for a more stable ride. (In comparison to the, at times, bumpy speed boat) ************************************************************************************************ PICK UP & DROP OFF INFO FOR SPEEDBOAT & CRUISE Pick-up included by air-conditioned van from any hotel from the following locations : Patong - Kalim - Karon - Kata - Kamala - Kathu - Surin - Bangtao - Chalong *All other locations have an add-on (extra charge) of 1,300THB per van. You can book this add-on on the payment page. Pick - up : 7.30 AM (Approx) Drop - off : 5 PM (Approx) ************************************************************************************************ LONG TAIL BOAT OPTION If you prefer to travel by local tail boat instead of speed boat, we also offer that option! This option is slightly cheaper and adds a local touch to the trip. The itinerary similar as cruise and the sights visited too. The only difference is in the drop off time. PICK UP TIME - 9.30 (Approx) DROP OFF TIME - 5 PM (Approx) ************************************************************************************************ PICK UP & DROP OFF INFO FOR LONG TAIL BOAT Locations 1 : Patong - Kalim - Karon - Kata : Return transport included by air-conditioned van. ADD ON LOCATIONS (can be booked on the payment page): Locations 2 : Kamala - Phuket Town - Surin - Bang Tao - Chalong : Extra - charge of 300 THB per person. Locations 3 : Mai Khao - Rawai - Nai Thon - Nai Yang - Cape Panwa : Extra charge of 1800 THB per private van upto 9 pax. . ************************************************************************************************
strTitle: 40% OFF James Bond Island & Phang Nga Bay Tour by Speed Boat

strIntroduction: •••••••••••••••••THE ULTIMATE ISLAND HOPPING EXPERIENCE••••••••••••••••• Escape the crowds and discover your own slice of paradise in the beautiful Phi Phi islands… The Phi Phi islands, lying just off the coast of Phuket, are widely-considered the most attractive in the Andaman Sea. With their secluded bays of pristine white sand ringed by towering limestone cliffs, mysterious caves, and turquoise waters rich in colourful marine life that prove irresistible for swimmers, it’s no surprise this is such a popular day-trip. The only problem is, many visitors arrive to find the bays already filled with boats, and it can be difficult to really appreciate the setting with so many other people around. ************************************************************************************************ 3 ITINERARIES Please choose from one of the following itineraries : ---Phi Phi Island Day tour inc. Khai Island--- 07.30 - 08.00 : Pick up from your hotel in Phuket. 09.00 : Depart from the pier for Phi Phi Islands 09.40 - 12.30 : Arrive Phi Phi Ley and Maya Bay. Explore Viking Cave, Monkey Beach, Nui Bay. (Snorkeling spots) 12.30 : Enjoy Thai buffet Lunch at Phi Phi Don Restaurant 13.30 : Depart from Phi Phi Don Island towards Khai Nok Island 14.20 : Arrive at “Khai Nok Island” - free time on the beach. 16.00 : Depart from Khai Island for return to Phuket. ---Phi Phi Island Day tour inc. Bamboo Island--- 07.30 - 08.00 : Pick up from your hotel in Phuket 09.00 : Depart from the pier for Phi Phi Islands 10.00 : Arrive Bamboo island, enjoy Swimming & Snorkeling 12.00 : Buffet lunch served at Phi Phi Don (Ton Sai Bay) 13.30 : Explore Monkey Bay, Viking Cave, Pileh Cove, Loh Samah 14.00 : Arrive at Maya Bay - swimming, relaxing and sunbathing! 16.30 : Arrive back at Royal Phuket Marina ---PHI PHI ISLAND BY CRUISE BOAT --- 07.00 - 08.00 : Pick up from your hotel in Phuket. 08.30 : Depart from the pier for Phi Phi Islands 10.15 : Arrive Phi Phi Ley (Snorkeling spots) 12.30 : Enjoy Thai buffet Lunch at Phi Phi Don Restaurant 14.30 : Depart from Phi Phi Don for return to Phuket. For CRUISE We have two options for this trip: --Standard-- Upto 450 Pax Standard Thai Buffet Lunch --VIP-- Max 45 Pax Rooftop VIP room access with free soift drinks & snacks Seafood Buffet Lunch ************************************************************************************************ WHAT YOUR DAY WILL LOOK LIKE (Order of sights may change on day depending on weather conditions) This magical tour, sure to be one of the highlights of your stay in Thailand, departs at 9 am from our lounge at the Royal Phuket Marina for Phi Phi Island Day tour inc. Bamboo Island trip. For Phi Phi Island Day tour inc. Khai Island will be depart from PNT pier at 9 AM. You’ll be picked up from your accommodation in Phuket and transfer to our comfortable speedboat. First stop is incredible Maya Bay, which became world-famous with the release of The Beach. Now you can picture yourself as Leonardo DiCaprio, sunbathing on silky white sands fringed by dramatic limestone peaks, roaming jungle paths among chattering birds, or snorkelling over the coral in the picturesque bay. We provide all the equipment you need, so just dive in! Pileh Cove, otherwise known as the Emerald Lagoon, is perhaps the most memorable stop on our tour, taking your breath away as soon as you see it. Leap from the boat into the warm waters for a swim, or simply bask in the incredible scenery. Passing Viking Cave, home to a colony of swiftlets whose nests are extremely valuable in Asian culture for their health-giving properties, the boat swings in close so you get the best views. Monkey Beach offers another highlight of the tour, where you’ll meet some cheeky and charming new friends while wandering the gorgeous white sands. You may even have the chance for a monkey-selfie. Next, you’ll head for either Loh Samah or Nui Bay, two scenic coves with tropical reefs ideal for a spot of snorkeling. After Nui Bay, we stopover on mainland Phi Phi Don for an authentic, fresh Thai buffet lunch. This is a great time to reflect on the day so far and catch up with other guests on the trip! We then head to Bamboo Island, where you can immerse yourself in the jaw-dropping landscape & extremely white sand beach. Snorkel over a great coral reef and spot a variety of sea-life! The final stop on our tour is majestic Mosquito Island, which is perfect for some afternoon snorkeling among shoals of brightly-coloured fish that inspire awe. Our fast speedboat will return you safely and happily back to the Royal Phuket Marina, from where a minibus will return you to your accommodation. Enjoy the memories - you’ll remember this Phuket day-trip for years. **Note - For Khai Island trip, switch Bamboo Island with Khai Nok Island. ************************************************************************************************ PICK UP & DROP OFF LOCATIONS & TIMINGS Pick-up included by air-conditioned van from any hotel from the following locations : KHAI ISLAND, BAMBOO ISLAND TOUR & CRUISE (BIG BOAT) TOUR ========== Locations 1 : ========== Patong - Kalim - Karon - Kata : Return transport included by air-conditioned van. Khai Island Extra charge of 1200 THB per private car up to 6 pax. strIntroduction: FLYING HANUMAN PHUKET Let’s admit it: we all wanted to be a character in the jungle book at some points of our lives. Talking to wildlife, traverse the rich forests and swinging from branch to branch like how King Louie would. At the Flying Hanuman Phuket, you’ll get to do exactly that. Built right next to a forest, this 80,000 square metre plot doesn’t just serve as an adventure playground but also as an extension of the forest. The facilities are built in a way that does minimal damage to the ecosystem while providing you with an immersive experience all at the same time. Plus, if you’re lucky, you might just catch a glimpse of nature’s own critters parading the activity ground. With three packages and two routes to choose from, partake in either the full 28-platform course or the abridged version consisting 16 platforms. Whether you’re a modern-day Tarzan or just trying to get acquainted with high elemental activities, there’s something for the young and young at heart. ************************************************************************************************ Full Course - 2.5 Hours Ziplining // JOURNEY A & B (28 platforms) In these packages, you’ll get the full Flying Hanuman experience. With 15 ziplines, you’ll first get acquainted with being airborne with shorter ziplines before conquering the 400-metre swing. Flying you from the east side of the island all the way to the west coast, your adrenaline is bound to be pumped. Apart from feeling the cool wind graze your skin and kissing your face, don’t forget to peek down to see the lush bed of trees. The view from above will truly illustrate to you why Phuket isn’t just about great beaches. For true thrill seekers, be glad to know during your journey each platform, it won’t be just plainly walking on flat terrains. With two Sky Bridges and abseil points in stored, you’ll feel like you’re a part of an action movie. But perhaps more than just getting a natural high from testing your limits, use this opportunity to marvel the lush nature that is Phuket from a whole new angle. Nature aficionados, this adventure is suitable for you as well. Apart from being a part of nature the whole time, the activity concludes with a 20-minute wilderness walk, where you’ll get acquainted with untouched nature in a calm and serene way. Both packages end with you returning to the main site, where you’ll be greeted with a platter of tropical fruits to refresh you from the adventure-filled experience. **Guests taking package A will be ushered to the selected restaurant for a full hearty meal. Journey B does not include a meal.** ************************************************************************************************ Beginner Course - 1.5 Hours Ziplining // DISCOVERY JOURNEY C (16 platforms) only available at 8 am or 3 pm So let’s say your heart isn’t ready for all that adventure at one go but you still want to have fun. Solve that dilemma with this package. Designed to be less tiring but still equally fun, you’ll make it to 16 platforms instead of 28. And don’t worry of the 8 ziplines you’ll be partaking, the longest one is only 100 metres. Just because this isn’t as wild as the other packages, doesn’t mean it’s totally boring. You’ll get to scale the platforms via spiral staircases and experience how it’s like to be a superhero too. The 15-metre abseil point promises you an exhilarating experience without sending shockwaves to your brain. Similar to the other packages, your journey will end with a fruit platter to quench your thirst as well as rejuvenate you. ************************************************************************************************ SAFETY At the Flying Hanuman Phuket, safety is the number one priority and the guides are seasoned high elements practitioners so be assured you're in safe hands. Apart from strapping you in all the gears to keep you safe, you'll be briefed on the proper decorum by your friendly guides to ensure you extra safety. The equipment and facility go through regular maintenance and checks and are only allowed to operate when they are in tip top condition. No worries if you're super big and tall either, the ziplines are designed to hold over several tonnes weight. ************************************************************************************************ GUIDES Our Guides at Flying Hanuman are trained professionals who specialize in activities high above ground and masters at using the equipment at their disposal. While you are there to experience the ziplining, our guides are there to lead the way and take care of everything else in between.. We ensure that each group has a minimum of 2 guides each, even if there is one guest in the group! Guides are partnered depending on experience, so guests will always have a senior guide with them. These men are the beating heart of Flying Hanuman, who make every adventure not only safe, but also special. ************************************************************************************************ FLYING SESSIONS Each session is 2 Hours long and you can only choose 1 slot from the following - Journeys A + B - 8 AM - 10 AM - 1 PM - 3PM Discovery Journey C - 8 AM - 3 PM Important - **Please let us know of your desired time-slot upon booking** ************************************************************************************************ PICK UP AND DROP OFF (From Phuket Only) Please confirm pick-up times upon booking. 8 AM section. The departure time from the venue is 10.30 - 11.00 10 AM section. The departure time from the venue is 12.30 - 13.00 1 PM section. The departure time from the venue is 15.30 - 16.00 3 PM section. The departure time from the venue is 17.30 - 18.00 ************************************************************************************************
